channel.title: Server not finding files
channel.description:
Hi Rune-Server.
So I decided to play around with a 317 a bit, as the newer revisions aren't quite as fun in my opinion. So I've downloaded a Rune-Sanctum release, fixed the anti-leech (as far as I can tell), and went ahead and ran the server. However, for some reason, the server is unable to locate multiple files, even though the packaging is correct.
Some images below, help is appreciated - thanks (:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/IsFSWra.png[/img][img]http://i.imgur.com/I1vkrZW.png[/img]
Thanks again.

item.title: Server not finding files
item.dc:creator: @Zailyx Zailyx
item.description:
@Zailyx wrote:

Figured out the issue. It was because the parent folder contained two packages so it was trying to read from like,

.data/cfg
instead of
./myserver/data/cfg

Read full topic

item.title: Server not finding files
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Sorry, each of my 3 paragraphs are not actually related to each other! I should have made that more clear.

Read full topic

item.title: Server not finding files
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Justin Bieber, post:3, topic:550753”]Can’t remember if directory names are case insensitive on windows, but try lowercasing “Data” just in case.

If that doesn’t work then it probably needs the path relative to bin, so …/data/definitions. Or just move the data directory into bin if you can’t be bothered or don’t know how to update the config.

Er… You probably need a .\ in front of that path so it’d be “.\data\definitions\items.dat”

Could try this, but I’d be very shocked if it actually fixed the problem. afaik “.\data\definitions” would be exactly the same as “data\definitions” in any context. I’ve only ever used “.” for running executables.[/quote]
My server loads files using .\ and not …
Haven’t had an issue with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Server not finding files
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Can’t remember if directory names are case insensitive on windows, but try lowercasing “Data” just in case.

If that doesn’t work then it probably needs the path relative to bin, so …/data/definitions. Or just move the data directory into bin if you can’t be bothered or don’t know how to update the config.

sk8rdude461:

Er… You probably need a .\ in front of that path so it’d be “.\data\definitions\items.dat”

Could try this, but I’d be very shocked if it actually fixed the problem. afaik “.\data\definitions” would be exactly the same as “data\definitions” in any context. I’ve only ever used “.” for running executables.

Read full topic

item.title: Server not finding files
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Er… You probably need a .\ in front of that path so it’d be “.\data\definitions\items.dat”

Read full topic
